column4: I want to force X to use 1440x900@60Hz but I can not work out how, every option i have tried in xorg.conf has not worked its at 75hz right now I need 60, does anyone know the correct settings? Gnome will only present me with 75hz
is anyone able to answer my question?

I want to force X to use 1440x900@60Hz but I can not work out how, every option i have tried in xorg.conf has not worked its at 75hz right now I need 60, does anyone know the correct settings? Gnome will only present me with 75hz
ive been trying to work this out all day
thats what i have been doing
ive tried every setting under the sun, X has not rejected any of it
in a  slightly less condescending manner, try adding Option "UseEDIDFreqs" "false"
I have a wide screen monitor tho
probe your monitor capabilities with "sudo hwinfo --monitor", specify the horizsync and vertrefresh
then build a modeline if need be
what am i adding that to?
I have modelines in there already
horizsync and vertrefresh go in section monitor
